title: D Gukesh opens up on future after becoming chess world champion: 'Main goal I have had is being the best in the world' - Firstpost
summary:
D Gukesh opens up on future after becoming chess world champion: 'Main goal I have had is being the best in the world'

Publication Date: Recent, Source: Firstpost

D Gukesh has made history by becoming the youngest world champion in chess after defeating Ding Liren 7.5-6.5 in the recent FIDE World Championship. His focus now shifts toward future endeavors while he enjoys the moment with family and friends.

  • D Gukesh won the championship with a scoreline of 7.5-6.5, clinching victory in Game 14.
  • At 18, he became the youngest world champion ever, breaking a 39-year-old record previously held by Garry Kasparov.
  • He expressed that while becoming a world champion is significant, his ultimate goal is to be recognized as the best player in the world.
  • Motivated by top players like Magnus Carlsen and Fabiano Caruana, Gukesh aims for continuous improvement and excellence in the sport.
“The main goal I have had is being the best in the world and achieving my full potential.” - D Gukesh

In summary, Gukesh's triumph marks not just a personal achievement but also positions him as a significant figure in the chess community with aspirations for even greater accomplishments.
newTitle: D Gukesh Becomes Youngest Chess World Champion and Eyes Future Goals

title: Jasprit Bumrah Goes Past Zaheer & Ishant's Tally To Take No. 2 Position In Elite List Led By Kapil Dev - News18
summary:
Jasprit Bumrah Surges to No. 2 in India's Elite Five-Wicket Haul List

Date: December 15, 2024

Source: News18

Star Indian pacer Jasprit Bumrah shone during the second day of the third Test against Australia, taking five wickets for 72 runs, surpassing Zaheer Khan and Ishant Sharma to secure the No. 2 spot for most five-wicket hauls among Indian pacers in Test history.

  • Bumrah achieved his 12th five-wicket haul in Tests, moving past Zaheer and Ishant's 11.
  • He dismissed notable players including Steve Smith (101) and Travis Head (152) in a single over.
  • Bumrah is now the leading bowler with eight five-wicket hauls in SENA countries, surpassing Kapil Dev's seven.
  • He has equaled Anil Kumble's tally of 49 wickets in Australia, aiming to break Kapil Dev’s record of 51 in the ongoing series.
  • This fifer is Bumrah's 9th in the World Test Championship, tying with Pat Cummins for the most by a fast bowler.
“Bumrah has displayed extraordinary bowling skills, becoming a crucial asset for the Indian cricket team.”

In conclusion, Jasprit Bumrah's recent performance not only cements his status among India's elite bowlers but also makes him a pivotal figure in the future landscape of Test cricket.
newTitle: Jasprit Bumrah Surges to No. 2 in India's Elite Five-Wicket Haul List
